Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Accelerometry-Based Motion Detectors in Brachial Plexus Reconstruction

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial included five male patients

Intervention.evidence: Participants wore bilateral accelerometry-based motion detectors for 7 days.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates accelerometry-based motion detectors for assessing functional outcomes post-nerve transfer.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the time of use ratio (VT) and magnitude ratio (VM) of the affected arm compared to the unaffected arm.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This randomised controlled trial included five male patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: The VT for the affected side compared to the unaffected side was 0.73 (±0.27), and the VM was 0.63 (±0.59).

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.
